title: 111_hr2891
content: The "Access to Frontline Health Care Act of 2009" includes a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program under the Public Health Service Act. The Secretary will establish a Frontline Providers Loan Repayment Program where individuals agree to serve as health professionals for at least 2 years in a healthcare facility in a scarcity area in exchange for student loan repayments. To be eligible, individuals must submit an application and sign a written contract. Participants are approved upon the Secretary's approval. The Loan Repayment Program requires approval from the Secretary for participation. Preference is given to applicants with interdisciplinary training. The Secretary determines scarcity areas for contract placement, prioritizing those with interdisciplinary healthcare programs. The Loan Repayment Program requires approval from the Secretary for participation, with a preference for applicants with interdisciplinary health care training. The contract includes an agreement for student loan repayment and frontline care services provision. The Loan Repayment Program requires approval from the Secretary for participation, with a preference for applicants with interdisciplinary health care training. The contract includes an agreement for student loan repayment and frontline care services provision for a period of full-time service of not less than 2 years at a health care facility serving a frontline care scarcity area. The financial obligations of the United States and the individual are contingent upon funds being appropriated for student loan repayment. The contract also outlines the damages the United States is entitled to in case of breach and includes other statements regarding the rights and liabilities of the Secretary and the individual. The Secretary determines the amount of annual student loan repayment under this section to recruit health care providers. Payments can be made directly to the loan provider. In case of breach of contract by failing to fulfill service obligation, the United States can recover the total amount paid to the individual plus interest. The section defines 'frontline care scarcity area' as a designated health professional shortage area or an area with a shortage of frontline care services. 'Frontline care services' include various healthcare services provided by specific healthcare professionals. The section authorizes appropriations for frontline care services provided by various healthcare professionals, including general surgeons, optometrists, physical therapists, pharmacists, and others. The authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2010 to 2015 are $78,000,000 to $153,000,000. For fiscal years 2013 to 2016, appropriations are set at $123,000,000, $138,000,000, $153,000,000, and adjusted annually based on the increase in health professions education costs. The Secretary must start the loan repayment program within 180 days of enactment.
